originalTitle: Family of Zambia's ex-President Lungu dismiss poisoning allegation - lawyers
title: Important News About Zambia's Former Leader!
content:
Hello, amazing friends all across Africa! Your kid-friendly news reporter is here with some important news. Today, we're talking about a very special person from a country called Zambia. His name was Mr. Lungu, and he used to be the President of Zambia. A President is like the head leader of a whole country, someone who helps make big decisions and looks after all the people. Just like your principal looks after your school, a President looks after their country!

Who Was President Lungu?

Mr. Lungu was the leader of Zambia for some years. Zambia is a beautiful country right here in Africa, with amazing animals and kind people. As President, he worked hard to help his country grow and make sure people were safe and happy. When someone is an 'ex-President', it means they were once the President, but now someone else is helping to lead the country. But even when they are not President anymore, they are still very important people who have done a lot for their country. **Did you know?** Africa has 54 different countries, and each one has a special leader like a President or a King or Queen!

Sad News About Mr. Lungu

Sadly, Mr. Lungu became very, very sick. When people get very sick, sometimes their bodies get too tired to keep fighting. Mr. Lungu passed away, which means he is not with us anymore. This is a very sad thing when someone important passes away, and it makes many people feel sad too. We remember all the good things they did.

Where Is He Now?

After someone passes away, their body needs to be kept safe until their family can say a proper goodbye and bury them. Mr. Lungu's body is currently in a special place in another country called South Africa. South Africa is also a big country in Africa, known for its beautiful beaches and big cities. Sometimes, if someone is very sick or needs special care, they might go to another country where there are very good doctors and hospitals. **Did you know?** A 'morgue' is a special, cool room where bodies are kept safe and respectful until their family is ready to say their final goodbyes. It's like a special safe place.

What Were People Saying?

After Mr. Lungu passed away, some people started saying stories that were not true. They were saying that maybe something bad happened to him, like someone tried to hurt him using something like poison. When we say 'poisoning allegation', it means someone *said* that bad thing happened, but it wasn't true. It's like when someone says your friend pushed you, but they really didn't. It's just a story that isn't real.

The Family Speaks Out

Now, Mr. Lungu's family, who loved him very, very much, has spoken out. They have said, "No, those stories are not true!" They want everyone to know the real truth. They told everyone that Mr. Lungu was just very, very sick from his illness, and that's why he passed away. His lawyers, who are like special helpers who talk for the family, told everyone this important message. The family wants people to remember Mr. Lungu for his good work and not listen to stories that are not true. **Did you know?** Lawyers are people who help families and friends understand big rules and speak for them when important things happen, like making sure everyone knows the truth.

Why Is This Important?

It's very important to know the truth. When we hear stories, especially about important people, it's good to make sure they are real stories. Mr. Lungu's family wants to make sure that everyone understands what really happened to their beloved husband and father. They want people to know he wasn't hurt by anyone, but just became very sick naturally. This helps everyone feel peaceful and stops people from being worried by untrue stories.

Coming Home Soon

Soon, Mr. Lungu's family will bring his body back home to Zambia. This is so that all the people of Zambia, and especially his family and friends, can say their final goodbyes in their home country. It’s a very important custom in many places to have a special farewell ceremony to honor someone who has done a lot for their community and country. **Did you know?** Families are very important! They support each other, love each other, and help each other through happy times and sad times. So, remember, friends, it's always best to listen to the people who know the truth, especially the family of someone important. We send our love to Mr. Lungu's family and all the people in Zambia during this sad time. We remember Mr. Lungu for being a leader who tried his best for his country.
summary: The family of Zambia's former President Lungu has said that stories about him being poisoned are not true, explaining he passed away because he was very sick.
whyMatters: It is important for everyone to know the truth about what happened to an important leader like Mr. Lungu, so people are not worried by untrue stories and can remember him for his good work.
